pullRequest.body:
This PR adds multiplicativity and composition results for `Polynomial.smeval` in the power-associative algebra setting.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Thank you for the very thorough review!
maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by kbuzzard.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8112138756/job/22172708101)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8112138756/job/22172707896)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8112138756/job/22172707421)

Other comments on this file:

Line 106: a suggestion is

```lean
  refine sum_add_index p q (smul_pow x) (fun _ ↦ ?_) (fun _ _ _ ↦ ?_)
  · rw [smul_pow, zero_smul]
  · rw [smul_pow, smul_pow, smul_pow, add_smul]
```

Whether or not you like the golfy intro-removal, the dots should
definitely be there (you have two goals in the infoview otherwise).

line 136: remove the @, line 139, exact rfl -> rfl.

***

This is great work! I don't know why you want this stuff in this generality, but I trust you know what you're doing, and your proofs are very elegant. Thanks!

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

  · rw [smul_pow, zero_smul]
  · rw [smul_pow, smul_pow, smul_pow, add_smul]

This is great work! I don't know why you want this stuff in this generality, but I trust you know what you're doing, and your proofs are very elegant. Thanks!

bors merge
Remove "commutative" from the docstring of this def?

I'm not suggesting you make this change but just FYI: you could instead write `variable (R)` on a line by itself before this theorem and it will change the binder, and then `variable {R}` will change it back for the later theorems.

```suggestion
  rfl
```

```suggestion
    (x: S) : letI : Module R S := RingHom.toModule f
```
`let` for data, `have` for proofs. Or do you know more than me and this was intentional? Given that the proof compiles I'm not 100% confident about my suggestion here.

```suggestion
  rfl
```

This looks to me like a very clever choice of instances. You are careful to avoid `[Algebra R S]`, and in my mental model of what's going on `[SMulCommClass R S S]` says "R is in the centre of S", but I don't have a good mental model for `[IsScalarTower R S S]`. If you feel like you have something insightful to say (e.g. an example where `Algebra R S` is no good but your hypotheses apply), can you put it in a module docstring above the variable and below the section (i.e. line 150)? Then it will show up in the online docs and people who aren't so well-versed in non-commutative rings will understand your subtle choice of instances here.

```suggestion
    | zero => simp only [Nat.zero_eq, monomial_zero_left, smeval_C, npow_zero, coeff_C_zero]
```

```suggestion
      mul_assoc, npow_add, smul_mul_assoc, npow_one]
```

```suggestion
    rw [← monomial_one_one_eq_X, monomial_mul_monomial, smeval_monomial, one_mul,
      npow_add, npow_one, ← mul_smul_comm, smeval_monomial]
```

```suggestion
theorem smeval_mul_X_pow : ∀ (n : ℕ), (p * X^n).smeval x = p.smeval x * x^n
```

```suggestion
theorem smeval_X_pow_mul : ∀ (n : ℕ), (X^n * p).smeval x = x^n * p.smeval x
```

```suggestion
    rw [← C_mul_X_pow_eq_monomial, mul_assoc, smeval_C_mul, smeval_X_pow_mul, smeval_add]
```

```suggestion
theorem smeval_pow : ∀ (n : ℕ), (p^n).smeval x = (p.smeval x)^n
```

```suggestion
    (x : S) : ⇑(aeval x) = fun (p : R[X]) ↦ smeval p x := by
```
`@` is usually regarded as a code smell.

```suggestion
  toFun := fun p => smeval p x
```

```suggestion
  map_mul' p q := smeval_mul R p q x
```
`exact` sees through definitional equality and `simp only` was only rewriting things whose proof was `rfl`. Also note that you don't need `intro`s when filling in structure fields: you can just put the variables left of the `:=`.

```suggestion
  commutes' r := by
```

```suggestion
    dsimp only
```
Just to make it clearer that all you're doing is tidying up definitionally (it's also probably a few milliseconds faster or whatever)

```suggestion
def smeval.algebraMap (R : Type*) [CommSemiring R] {S : Type*} [Semiring S] [Algebra R S]
```
I make this suggestion because it enables you to remove an `@` later on. Experience will end up telling you whether you want `R` explicit or implicit.

```suggestion
    (x : S) (p : R[X]) : smeval.algebraMap R x p = p.smeval x := rfl
```
(if you decide to make `R` explicit in `algebraMap`).

```suggestion
    (x : S) : Polynomial.aeval x = smeval.algebraMap R x := by
```
if you decide to make `R` explicit in `smeval.algebraMap`. And
```suggestion
    (x : S) : Polynomial.aeval x = (smeval.algebraMap x : R[X] →ₐ[R] S) := by
```
if you don't. But the fact you need an `@` or extra type information is evidence that you might be better off making it explicit. Note that `R` is explicit in `_root.algebraMap R A : R ->*+ A`.

```suggestion
  ext
  simp only [aeval, smeval.algebraMap, eval₂AlgHom'_apply, eval₂_X, AlgHom.coe_mk, RingHom.coe_mk,
    MonoidHom.coe_mk, OneHom.coe_mk, smeval_X, pow_one]
```
`unfold` is usually regarded as a code smell as well. Here you can just load it into the `simp`.

Given these are equal, do we actually need `smeval.algebraMap`? I think we could get away with just showing that
```suggestion
    (x : S) (p : R[X]) : Polynomial.aeval x p = p.smeval x := by
```
I have removed `smeval.algebraMap`, and added a simpler comparison result.
